elements.title: Divertimento
elements.contents: ... that at its premiere at Symphony Hall, Leonard Bernstein (pictured) described his suite Divertimento as a "fun piece" that "reflects my youthful experiences here where I heard my first orchestral music"?

elements.title: Irene Desmet
elements.contents: ... that Irene Desmet, a Liverpudlian paediatric surgeon, was described by one of her trainees as "an iron fist in a velvet glove"?

elements.title: Johannesburg
elements.contents: ... that Gil Scott-Heron's 1975 song "Johannesburg" was banned in South Africa during apartheid?

elements.title: T. Mohandas Pai
elements.contents: ... that Indian philanthropist and business executive T. Mohandas Pai has been called the "architect of modern Manipal"?

elements.title: a Virginia radio station
elements.contents: ... that a Virginia radio station built a house to raise money for operations?

elements.title: Peter Corby
elements.contents: ... that Peter Corby's electric trouser press used technology designed for Concorde?

elements.title: Antar Lintas Sumatera
elements.contents: ... that at over 2,800 kilometres (1,700 mi), Antar Lintas Sumatera's Medan-to-Jember service is the longest bus route in Indonesia?

elements.title: Roman art collector
elements.contents: ... that Pliny used the term insania to describe a Roman art collector's love of citron tables?
